page.title: 01Whitfield
page.content: The West Allen runs from N to S through the centre of the block. The E bank of the dale is steep and partly wooded throughout. The western side becoms steeper towards the N. In the centre of the block, Whitfield Hall stands on a raised allured plain between Blaeberry Burn, Carrs Burn and the West Allen. The parkland is used for grazing, but is still recognizably landscaped. Whitfield village (formarly Bear's Bridge) stands on the bank of the West Allen; its post office and police house serve NW Allendale. The area is intensively farmed; sheep and cattle are raised and hay is harvested except in the extreme NW and SE of the block, where there is rough fell grazing. Forestry is also an important industry.
